response_data.response:
🦠 **ED Sepsis Protocol**

📊 **Severity Criteria:**
• **Severe Sepsis:** Lactate > 2.0 mmol/L
• **Septic Shock:** Lactate > 4.0 mmol/L

⏱️ **Time-Critical Actions:**
• Antibiotics within 1 hour of recognition
• 30mL/kg fluid bolus within 3 hours if hypotensive
• Repeat lactate and reassess at 3 hours

**Protocol Details:**

ED SEPSIS PATHWAY

Overview:
Two focused evaluations required for all suspected sepsis patients:
1. Initial evaluation - Decide likelihood of sepsis, screen for severe sepsis or septic shock
2. Reassessment - Measure impact of resuscitation with repeat lactate, post-fluid BP

Severity Criteria:
• Severe sepsis: Lactate > 2 mmol/L
• Septic shock: Lactate > 4 mmol/L

Initial Actions (0:00-1:00):
• ...

🚨 **Anaphylaxis Treatment Protocol**

💉 **FIRST-LINE TREATMENT:**
• **Adult:** Epinephrine 1mg/mL (1:1000) injection, 0.5mg IM
• **Pediatric:** 0.01mg/kg IM

**Treatment Details:**

ANAPHYLAXIS TREATMENT GUIDELINE

Definition:
Acute, life-threatening, generalized or systemic severe allergic reaction

First-Line Treatment:
• Epinephrine 0.3-0.5mg IM (1:1000 concentration)
• Administer in anterolateral thigh (vastus lateralis muscle)
• Can repeat every 5-15 minutes as needed
• No absolute contraindications in anaphylaxis

Second-Line Treatments:
• H1 antihistamines: Diphenhydr...

🍯 **Hypoglycemia Treatment Protocol**

💉 **TREATMENT:**
• **IV Access:** 50mL (25g) D50 IV over 2-5 minutes
• **Oral Route:** 15-20 grams rapid-acting carbohydrates

**Protocol Details:**

HYPOGLYCEMIA TREATMENT GUIDELINES

Definition:
Adult patient presents to ED and found to be hypoglycemic (Blood Glucose <70 mg/dL)
Symptomatic hypoglycemia includes patients with hypoglycemia symptoms even with blood glucose 70-100 mg/dL

Treatment Algorithm:

For Conscious Patients:
• If IV access available: Give 50mL (25g) D50 IV over 2-5 minutes
• If POCG remains <100 after treatment, repeat a...
